meanings.definition: To place on or as if on a pinnacle.
meanings.sent1: She pinnacled the trophy on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The architect pinnacled the tower with a golden spire.
meanings.sent3: The chef pinnacled the cake with a cherry on top.
meanings.sent4: His success pinnacled when he won the championship.
meanings.sent5: The sun pinnacled in the sky at noon.

meanings.definition: To furnish with a pinnacle or pinnacles.
meanings.sent1: They pinnacled the castle with flags for the celebration.
meanings.sent2: The gate was pinnacled with intricate ironwork.
meanings.sent3: The treehouse was pinnacled with fairy lights for the party.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was pinnacled with a sparkling brooch.
meanings.sent5: The mountain was pinnacled with snow in the winter.

meanings.sent1: His career pinnacled when he became the CEO.
meanings.sent2: The singer pinnacled to fame after her hit song.
meanings.sent3: The balloon pinnacled to the sky before slowly descending.
meanings.sent4: The rocket pinnacled into space with a burst of flames.
meanings.sent5: Her excitement pinnacled when she saw her favorite band live.
